2. 1. Why did the grapefruit go to the doctor? Because it was feeling a little fruit-loop!
2. What did the grapefruit say to the knife? "Cut it out!" (But please don't actually cut it out, I need you to eat me!)
3. 1. "I tried to start my day with a grapefruit, but ended up just eating a bowl of tart, bitter regret."
2. "If grapefruit were a person, it would be that friend who always tells the most awkward, uncomfortable jokes at parties."
4. 1. "Why did the grapefruit go to the doctor? It was feeling a little juicy!"
2. "I tried to start a grapefruit diet, but I just couldn't seem to get a pulp."

sampled:

Two of them involve a play on words with "citrus" and "expense," one involves a play on words with "fruit-loop" and "Froot Loops" cereal, and one involves a play on words with "juicy." While the jokes are different, the subject matter is not diverse.

2. 1. Why did the watermelon go to summer camp? Because it wanted to get juicy and fit!
2. What did the watermelon say to the other fruit? "I'm a-melon-izing!" [amazing]
3. 1. Why did the watermelon go to summer camp? To learn how to swim!
2. I asked the watermelon if it wanted to come to the beach with me, but it said it was too seed-y.

2. "I told my wife she was drawing her eyebrows too high. She looked surprised."

5. Text 4 mentions tie-dyeing, which is not mentioned in the other texts.

Based on the above reasoning, the texts are diverse.
